text: Nivaria Tejera (30 September 1929 - 6 January 2016) was a Cuban poet and novelist. She was awarded the Seix Barral Biblioteca Breve prize in 1971 for her novel Son√°mbulo del sol. Her book, The Ravine (2007), is based on her early life. Tejera was born in Cienfuegos, Cienfuegos Province. Her mother was Cuban and her father was Spanish. She grew up in Tenerife, Canary Islands, Spain. She lived in Paris, France until her death. Tejera died from pancreatic cancer on 6 January 2016 in Paris, aged 86. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Spanish writers Category:People from the Canary Islands Category:Spanish poets
